skill.name: generate-output
skill.description: Create the deliverable (code, documentation, tests, content) following the user's standards and best practices. Use after validation passes to actually build the work product.
skill.summary: Create the deliverable (code, documentation, tests, content) following the user's standards and best...
skill.author: AbeJitsu

security_audit.summary: This is a pure prompt-based documentation skill with no executable code. All static findings are false positives triggered by documentation text and JSON metadata. The skill contains only markdown documentation describing a workflow for generating deliverables based on user standards.

content.user_title: Generate Production Deliverables from Validated Requirements
content.value_statement: Transform validated requirements into production-ready code, documentation, tests, and content. The skill automatically applies your project standards and patterns to ensure consistency across all deliverables.
actual_capabilities: Generate production-ready code with type annotations, error handling, and documentation
Create structured documentation with examples, troubleshooting sections, and proper formatting
Write comprehensive test suites covering happy paths and edge cases
Produce refactored code with before-after comparisons and improvement explanations
Apply project-specific principles and patterns from standards repository
Follow user-defined common patterns and anti-patterns automatically
limitations: Requires validated requirements from a previous validation step
Depends on standards repository for project-specific pattern application
Does not execute or validate generated code automatically
Assumes standards.json file exists for custom pattern enforcement

use_cases.title: Build Code Features
use_cases.description: Create production-ready components and modules with proper types, error handling, and inline documentation from specs.

use_cases.title: Produce Documentation
use_cases.description: Generate structured documentation with clear examples, troubleshooting guides, and consistent formatting standards.

use_cases.title: Create Test Coverage
use_cases.description: Build comprehensive test suites with setup, teardown, happy paths, and edge case validation logic.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Component
prompt_templates.prompt: Use generate-output skill to create a React button component with click handlers. Load standards from my project.

prompt_templates.title: API Documentation
prompt_templates.prompt: Use generate-output skill for Documentation project type. Document the POST /users endpoint with request params, response format, and error codes.

prompt_templates.title: Test Suite Creation
prompt_templates.prompt: Use generate-output skill for Test Suite project type. Create tests for AuthService class including authentication success, failure, and token expiry scenarios.

prompt_templates.title: Advanced Refactoring
prompt_templates.prompt: Use generate-output skill for Refactoring type. Refactor UserManager class to apply SOLID principles from my standards. Show before-after code and explain each improvement.

output_examples.input: Generate a searchable dropdown React component with keyboard navigation following my TypeScript standards.
output: Complete TypeScript component with interface definitions and type safety
Keyboard event handlers for arrow navigation, enter selection, and escape close
PropTypes validation and JSDoc comments on complex functions
Storybook story file with multiple usage examples
Error boundary for graceful failure handling

output_examples.input: Create documentation for the user authentication API endpoints.
output: Overview section explaining authentication flow and token lifecycle
Detailed endpoint specifications with request-response examples
Troubleshooting section for common error codes and resolutions
Security best practices and rate limiting information
Code examples in multiple languages showing proper usage

best_practices: Always load project standards before generating to match existing codebase conventions and patterns
Include all necessary supporting elements such as types, error handling, comments, and usage examples
Self-check deliverables against user-defined principles and anti-patterns before presenting output
anti_patterns: Generating deliverables without consulting project-specific standards and common patterns first
Omitting error handling, validation, or type safety for complex logic sections
Creating incomplete outputs that require significant additional work before they can be used

faq.question: Which AI platforms support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Install it through your AI tool's skills manager or marketplace interface.

faq.question: What types of deliverables can be generated?
faq.answer: Code features, documentation, test suites, refactored code, and content. Each deliverable type has specific guidance for structure and quality.

faq.question: How does the skill learn my project standards?
faq.answer: It reads your standards.json file using StandardsRepository to load project-specific principles, common patterns, and anti-patterns for your project type.

faq.question: What happens if I do not have a standards file?
faq.answer: The skill generates output following general best practices for the project type. Create standards.json to enforce custom patterns and conventions.

faq.question: Is this different from basic code generation?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill specifically applies your saved patterns, principles, and anti-patterns to ensure consistency with your existing codebase and workflow.

faq.question: Does this skill access external services?
faq.answer: No. This is a prompt-based skill that processes requirements locally without sending data to external services or making network calls.
